nodes.documentation:
Event is broadcast to the Ethereum blockchain to signify 
that a token purchase has just been made.
nodes.name: TokensPurchased

nodes.documentation:
Allows anyone to query the total amount of tokens sold on the ICO 
contract.
    * @return The total amount of tokens sold.
nodes.name: getTotalTokensSold

nodes.documentation:
Allows anyone to query if the ICO has ended. 
    * @return True if the ICO deadline has passsed, or if the ICO has 
been cancelled. False otherwise. *
nodes.name: icoHasEnded

nodes.documentation:
Allows anyone to query the contract address of the ERC20 token 
on sale. 
    * @return The contract address of the ERC20 token on sale. *
nodes.name: getTokenAddress

nodes.documentation:
This is a fallback function which is only ever invoced at the time 
when the address of the ICO contract receives ETH. This is because
when ETH is sent to the contract address, the EVM will look to 
execute a function and when it does not find a suitable function 
it will default to the fallback function. 

    * It is also worth noting that this function is a payable function 
meaning that the function accepts ETH. Without any payable functions 
in a smart contract, the contract cannot store any ETH sent to it. 

    * This function allows investors to simply send ETH to the ICO contract 
address and they will automatically receive tokens to the same address 
of which they sent ETH from. This is because this fallback function 
invoces the 'buyTokens' funciton and passes through msg.sender as the 
argument (this means the address of the investor).*

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "The deadline has passed or the ICO has been cancelled"

arguments.value: The deadline has passed or the ICO has been cancelled

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "The deadline has passed or the ICO has been cancelled"

nodes.documentation:
Allows investors to buy tokens with ETH. This function is a special 
type of function because it has the 'payable' modifier meaning that 
it is a function that accepts ETH as part of the function invocation. 
The ETH that is received as part of the transaction is taken into 
account and the tokens to be sent to the investor in return is 
calculated at the given exchange rate set by the owner of the contract. 

    * This function can either be invoced manually, or it can be invoced 
internally by the fallback function of the contract. In 99% of cases
the function will be invoced by the fallback function (described above). 

    * @param _investor - The address of the investor of which the tokens 
purchased shall be sent to.
nodes.name: buyTokens

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "No refunds possible at this time"

arguments.value: No refunds possible at this time

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "No refunds possible at this time"

nodes.documentation:
Allows investors to claim a refund if the softcap has not been 
reached before the deadline, or if the ICO has been cancelled 
by the owner.
nodes.name: claimRefund

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Withdrawals not possible at this time"

arguments.value: Withdrawals not possible at this time

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Withdrawals not possible at this time"

nodes.documentation:
Allows the owner of the contract to withdraw all the ETH which is 
in the contract given that the softcap has been reached prior to 
the deadline and also if the owner of the contract did not cancel 
the ICO. *
nodes.name: withdrawEth
withdrawTokens

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "The new rate must be greater than zero"

arguments.value: The new rate must be greater than zero

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "The new rate must be greater than zero"

nodes.documentation:
Allows the owner of the contract to set a new exchange rate at which 
tokens will be sold. 

    * @param _newRate - The new exchange rate. *
nodes.name: changeRate

nodes.documentation: Allows the owner of the ICO contract to cancel the ICO. *
nodes.name: cancelICO

Allows the owner of the contract to shorten the deadline of the ICO.

    * @param _newDeadline - The new deadline in days from the moment of 
invocation.

nodes.documentation:
This is a fallback function which is only ever invoced at the time 
when the address of the ICO contract receives ETH. This is because
when ETH is sent to the contract address, the EVM will look to

it will default to the fallback function. 

    * It is also worth noting that this function is a payable function 
meaning that the function accepts ETH. Without any payable functions

    * This function allows investors to simply send ETH to the ICO contract

Allows investors to buy tokens with ETH. This function is a special 
type of function because it has the 'payable' modifier meaning that 
it is a function that accepts ETH as part of the function invocation. 
The ETH that is received as part of the transaction is taken into

params._durationInDays: - The total amount of days the ICO will be active for.
params._ethSoftCap: - The minimum amount of ETH that needs to be raised.
params._rate: - The exchange rate of ETH to the token.
params._tokenAddress: - The contract address of the ERC20 token which will be on sale.
params._tokenDecimals: - The number of decimals of the ERC20 token

params._newOwner: - The address of the new owner.

params._to: - The address to send the tokens to.
params._tokensToWithdraw: - The amount of tokens to withdraw. *

assignOwner(address).notice: Initializes the owner variable with an address (can only be invoked once).

buyTokens(address).notice: Allows investors to buy tokens with ETH. This function is a special  type of function because it has the 'payable' modifier meaning that  it is a function that accepts ETH as part of the function invocation.  The ETH that is received as part of the transaction is taken into  account and the tokens to be sent to the investor in return is  calculated at the given exchange rate set by the owner of the contract.      * This function can either be invoced manually, or it can be invoced  internally by the fallback function of the contract. In 99% of cases the function will be invoced by the fallback function (described above).

cancelICO().notice: Allows the owner of the ICO contract to cancel the ICO. *

changeRate(uint256).notice: Allows the owner of the contract to set a new exchange rate at which  tokens will be sold.

claimRefund().notice: Allows investors to claim a refund if the softcap has not been  reached before the deadline, or if the ICO has been cancelled  by the owner.

methods.constructor: Initializes the state variables of the ICO contract and also assigns the owner to  be the address from which the transaction originated.

getOwner().notice: Returns the ETH address of the owner of any contract which  inherits this contract.

getTokenAddress().notice: Allows anyone to query the contract address of the ERC20 token  on sale.

getTotalTokensSold().notice: Allows anyone to query the total amount of tokens sold on the ICO  contract.

icoHasEnded().notice: Allows anyone to query if the ICO has ended.

shortenDeadline(uint256).notice: Allows the owner of the contract to shorten the deadline of the ICO.

transferOwnership(address).notice: Allows the current owner of the contract and all contracts  which inherit this contract to transfer ownership to another  ETH address. This function can only be invoked by the owner  of the contract.

withdrawEth().notice: Allows the owner of the contract to withdraw all the ETH which is  in the contract given that the softcap has been reached prior to  the deadline and also if the owner of the contract did not cancel  the ICO. *

withdrawTokens(address,uint256).notice: Allows the owner of the ICO to withdraw tokens from the contract.
